intro: Perymenium latisquamum, commonly known as the broad-scaled perymenium, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf structure. It typically features compound leaves with broad, flat leaflets that are arranged in a pinnate pattern. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers in umbel-like clusters, which are typical of the carrot family. Its habitat is often moist, shaded areas, and it is found in parts of Southeast Asia. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, though its use is less common compared to other members of its family.
